metadata.title: USN-6451-1 -- ncurses vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ncurses could be made to read out of bounds. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6451-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libx32ncurses5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib32tinfo-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 ncurses-examples - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib32ncurses5-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib32ncursesw5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libtinfo-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libncursesw5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libtinfo5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib64tinfo5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib32ncurses5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libncurses5-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 ncurses-bin - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib64ncurses5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib64ncurses5-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libncurses5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libx32ncurses5-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib32tinfo5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 ncurses-base - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 lib32ncursesw5-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 ncurses-doc - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libx32ncursesw5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libx32ncursesw5-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libx32tinfo-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libx32tinfo5 - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 libncursesw5-dev - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 ncurses-term - 6.0+20160213-1ubuntu1+esm4 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
